meanings.definition: A person or thing that proves something.
meanings.sent1: The prover presented evidence in court.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the prover to show his theory was correct.
meanings.sent3: The prover, a clever detective, solved the mystery in no time.
meanings.sent4: Her success in the competition was the ultimate prover of her skills.
meanings.sent5: The prover's demonstration left everyone convinced of the truth.

meanings.definition: A device used to test or demonstrate the accuracy or effectiveness of something.
meanings.sent1: The prover indicated that the machine was functioning properly.
meanings.sent2: The technician calibrated the prover before running the test.
meanings.sent3: The prover beeped loudly, signaling the completion of the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The prover acted as a reliable judge of the product's quality.
meanings.sent5: The prover's results were crucial in determining the success of the project.

meanings.definition: A person who establishes the truth or validity of something.
meanings.sent1: The prover confirmed the accuracy of the data.
meanings.sent2: The historian was known as a skilled prover of ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The prover's keen eye caught the mistake in the document.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as a prover of facts was well-deserved.
meanings.sent5: The prover's testimony was the key to solving the case.
